meanings.definition: The starchy tuberous root of a tropical tree, used as a staple food in many tropical countries.
meanings.sent1: In the market, the cassavas looked fresh and ready to be cooked.
meanings.sent2: The villagers harvested cassavas to make delicious meals for their families.
meanings.sent3: When the cassavas started dancing in the pot, everyone knew it was time to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as comforting as a warm plate of cassavas on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the cassavas cooking filled the entire kitchen.

meanings.definition: The plant itself, which is native to South America and widely cultivated for its edible roots.
meanings.sent1: The cassavas in the garden grew tall and healthy under the sun.
meanings.sent2: Farmers take great care of the cassavas to ensure a good harvest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide its acorns among the cassavas.
meanings.sent4: The cassavas swayed gently in the breeze, like a green sea of leaves.
meanings.sent5: Children played hide-and-seek among the towering cassavas.
